Docs.summary: DOMErrorHandler is a callback interface that the DOM implementation can call when reporting errors that happens while processing XML data, or when doing some other processing (e.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance bool HandleError(class Org.W3c.Dom.IDOMError error) cil managed

Docs.param: The error object that describes the error. This object may be reused by the DOM implementation across multiple calls to the handleError method.
Docs.summary: This method is called on the error handler when an error occurs.
Docs.returns: If the handleError method returns false, the DOM implementation should stop the current processing when possible. If the method returns true, the processing may continue depending on DOMError.severity.
